intro: Plectronia gilfillani, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and branched. Plectronia gilfillani is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats, making it an important species for wetland ecosystems.
